welcomeMessage: Hi **@chauler**, how can I help you?

parts.text:
Context: You are an accessibility expert reviewing HTML for accessibility issues. Analyze the following code in the context of WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) 2.2, listing any issues that may violate these guidelines. You will only be analyzing the HTML, ignoring any included or missing styles and scripts. Code: ``` Restaurant Menu
  • Home
  • Menu
  • About Us

Welcome to Our Restaurant

Delicious food just for you! View Menu

Our Menu

Food Item Name

Description of the food item.

$10.99

© 2023 Restaurant Name. All rights reserved.

``` Response format: Snippet with error: … Location of error: … WCAG Guideline violated: … Detection Algorithm: … Explanation of Error: …

message.text:
Context: You are an accessibility expert reviewing HTML for accessibility issues. Analyze the following code in the context of WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) 2.2, listing any issues that may violate these guidelines. You will only be analyzing the HTML, ignoring any included or missing styles and scripts. Code: ``` Restaurant Menu
  • Home
  • Menu
  • About Us

Welcome to Our Restaurant

Delicious food just for you! View Menu

Our Menu

Food Item Name

Description of the food item.

$10.99

© 2023 Restaurant Name. All rights reserved.

``` Response format: Snippet with error: … Location of error: … WCAG Guideline violated: … Detection Algorithm: … Explanation of Error: …

response.value:
Snippet with error: `<html lang="eg">`
Location of error: Line 2
WCAG Guideline violated: 3.1.1 Language of Page
Detection Algorithm: Check the `lang` attribute in the `<html>` tag.
Explanation of Error: The `lang` attribute is set to "eg" which is not a valid language code. It should be set to a valid language code that represents the primary language of the page's content.

---

Snippet with error: `<font size="5"> Delicious food just for you!</font>`
Location of error: Line 21
WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships
Detection Algorithm: Check for deprecated HTML elements.
Explanation of Error: The `<font>` tag is deprecated and should not be used. Styling should be done using CSS.

---

Snippet with error: `<label for="search">Search:</label>`
Location of error: Line 29 and Line 30
WCAG Guideline violated: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value
Detection Algorithm: Check for duplicate labels for the same form control.
Explanation of Error: There are two labels for the same input field. Each form control should have a unique label.

---

Snippet with error: `<div class="menu-item" onmouseover="ExternalFunction()">`
Location of error: Line 37
WCAG Guideline violated: 2.1.1 Keyboard
Detection Algorithm: Check for mouse-specific event handlers.
Explanation of Error: The `onmouseover` event handler is mouse-specific. All functionality should be accessible using the keyboard.

---

Snippet with error: `<button>Add to Cart</button>`
Location of error: Line 43
WCAG Guideline violated: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value
Detection Algorithm: Check for buttons without an accessible name.
Explanation of Error: The button does not have an accessible name. It should have an `aria-label` or `aria-labelledby` attribute to provide a name for assistive technologies.

followups.message: What are some alternative ways to style text in HTML instead of using the deprecated `<font>` tag?

b.description: Ask Copilot or type / for commands

metadata.helpTextPrefix: You can ask me general programming questions, or chat with the following participants which have specialized expertise and can perform actions:
metadata.helpTextVariablesPrefix: You can also help me understand your question by using the following variables to give me extra context:

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.
* **Review my suggested code** and tell me about issues or improvements, so I can iterate on it.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

Learn more about [GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode&utm_source=editor&utm_medium=chat-panel&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-getstarted) in [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/overview).

b.name: GitHub Copilot

parts.text: Are there any more issues? List all that you find.

message.text: Are there any more issues? List all that you find.

response.value:
Snippet with error: `` Location of error: Line 39 WCAG Guideline violated: 1.1.1 Non-text Content Detection Algorithm: Check the `alt` attribute of `` tags. Explanation of Error: The `alt` attribute of the image is not descriptive enough. It should provide a meaningful description of the image content. --- Snippet with error: `View Menu` Location of error: Line 22 WCAG Guideline violated: 2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context) Detection Algorithm: Check the text inside `` tags. Explanation of Error: The link text "View Menu" may not be descriptive enough out of context. Consider using more descriptive link text or adding an `aria-label` attribute. --- Snippet with error: `` element does not have an associated label. All form controls should have an associated label to provide context and meaning for assistive technologies. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: Line 43 WCAG Guideline violated: 2.4.3 Focus Order Detection Algorithm: Check for interactive elements without explicit order. Explanation of Error: The button does not have an explicit order. Interactive elements should have a logical tab order that matches the visual order, which can be set using the `tabindex` attribute. --- Snippet with error: `
` Location of error: Line 18 WCAG Guideline violated: 2.4.1 Bypass Blocks Detection Algorithm: Check for large sections of content without a way to bypass them. Explanation of Error: The page does not provide a way to bypass large sections of content. Consider adding skip links at the start of the page that link to the main sections of the page.

followups.message: What are some best practices for improving the accessibility of HTML code?

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.
* **Review my suggested code** and tell me about issues or improvements, so I can iterate on it.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

Learn more about [GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode&utm_source=editor&utm_medium=chat-panel&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-getstarted) in [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/overview).
